comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:6.0.2) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0.2
Build ID: 20110902133214

Steps to reproduce:

Stated Firefox.  Top of foxnews screen displays "Page not Found" error and persists upon closing and reopening.
Totally removed Firefox and reinstalled, and issue went away for one session, then returned.  Neither IE or Chrome have this issue.  Only Firefox.

Have captured the page info in text file and screen as complete HTML of a session to look at.

Modified the IPv6 and DNSload to "True" (have settings recorded) with no relief.  Believe this to be in the Core of Firefox.

Have attached an RAR file (Mozilla Fox Issue.rar) with as many details as I could get.


Actual results:

Error displayed of "Page not Found" at top of screen.


Expected results:

Page should have loaded normally as with IE.
comments.creator: dozierhc@aol.com
comments.author: dozierhc@aol.com

comments.raw_text: Please clear the disk cache (ctrl+shift+del, everything, only cache checked) and try it again
comments.author: bugzilla@mversen.de
